alert.note: Alert for Eastern Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 07 at 8:55PM EDT until September 08 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...A high risk of rip currents and rough nearshore surf. * WHERE...Eastern Currituck County. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 4 to 6 ft will result in rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. COROLLA NC MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.5 FT, MODERATE 6.0 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 08/06 AM 4.8 1.1 1.3 5-6 NONE 08/07 PM 5.8 2.1 1.4 6 MINOR 09/07 AM 4.9 1.2 1.1 5-6 NONE 09/07 PM 5.4 1.7 1.1 6 NONE 10/08 AM 4.5 0.8 0.5 6 NONE &&
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
